description.narrative: Output 3: By 2017, children, parents, care-givers and community members in selected areas understand and demonstrate positive behaviour that protects children from violence, abuse, exploitation, discrimination and neglect., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome (1): Children, especially girls, are better served by an effective Child and Family Welfare System that protects them from violence, abuse, exploitation, discrimination and neglect.

description.narrative: Over 800,000 girls, women, boys and men sensitized about the issues related to child protection and gender based violence; evidence collected which demonstrates increased in knowledge and understanding. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

baseline.value: No comprehensive information on child online safety

actual.value: 2017:The study on child online safety has been validated by stakeholders and is being finalized for publication. It was also cited in the state of the world children's report

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Targetted parents/primary caregivers reached by programmes addressing child-rearing practices

baseline.value: Roll out of the Community Facilitation toolkit

title.narrative: social drive campaign on the protection of children launched

target.value: 2017:Social drive campaign on child protection launched

actual.value: 2017:The Second Lady of the Republic of Ghana launched a nationwide social drive campaign on the 21st November 2017. The campaign is to engage all Ghanaians Against Child Abuse (GACA)
